subject: RBD driver: added support for ceph-mon's msgr2
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-04-26 18:38:21.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/rbd.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/volume/drivers/test_rbd.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/950f7fa6abef1a5d22dda594fc2952f22512a54c', 'message': 'RBD driver: added support for ceph-mon's msgr2

Since Ceph Nautilus release was added Ceph Messenger V2 Protocol (msgr2)
monmap now includes field 'public_addrs' in JSON, but Cinder uses old 'addr'
field. Currently impossible to run Cinder on msgr2 with "dual stack" of msgrs,
because ceph-mon by default fill v1 value host:port for 'addr' field.
With this situation impossible to disable msgr1 protocol on old installations
without volume service shutdown's, but with this patch we can:

* after msgr2 enabled:
    * restart cinder (all new 'connection_info.data.ports' will be 3300)
    * update ceph.conf everywhere with :3300 port instead :6789
    * update 'block_device_mapping.connection_info' for all volumes in nova
    * update all xml's for vm in hypervisors memory
* disable msgr1 protocol

Signed-off-by: Konstantin Shalygin <k0ste@k0ste.ru>
Change-Id: Ib54ce093b471612ac6409458241024865a0e2dc3
'}]
commit_message:
RBD driver: added support for ceph-mon's msgr2

Since Ceph Nautilus release was added Ceph Messenger V2 Protocol (msgr2)
monmap now includes field 'public_addrs' in JSON, but Cinder uses old 'addr'
field. Currently impossible to run Cinder on msgr2 with "dual stack" of msgrs,
because ceph-mon by default fill v1 value host:port for 'addr' field.
With this situation impossible to disable msgr1 protocol on old installations
without volume service shutdown's, but with this patch we can:

* after msgr2 enabled:
    * restart cinder (all new 'connection_info.data.ports' will be 3300)
    * update ceph.conf everywhere with :3300 port instead :6789
    * update 'block_device_mapping.connection_info' for all volumes in nova
    * update all xml's for vm in hypervisors memory
* disable msgr1 protocol

Signed-off-by: Konstantin Shalygin <k0ste@k0ste.ru>
Change-Id: Ib54ce093b471612ac6409458241024865a0e2dc3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/24/839424/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: Let WSGI apps signal that a client connection should be closed
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2021-07-07 16:37:27.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/swift/commit/96656824d1c6eae5389ee60adbe3f80a37258dfd', 'message': "Let WSGI apps signal that a client connection should be closed

The WSGI spec makes eventlet (as WSGI server) pretty clearly responsible
for connection management, and it errs on the side of allowing
connection reuse, even when the client wants to send a *massive* amount
of data.

Since we've already got our own SwiftHttpProtocol that we pass down
to eventlet, we can use some of eventlet's existing machinery to take
on this decision ourselves. We might want to do this if we expect the
client to send us a *lot* of data that we'd just discard, or if we're
worried about request framing issues.

Update the proxy server to close out the connection whenever it would
respond:

   * 408 Request Timeout,
   * 411 Length Required,
   * 413 Request Entity Too Large, or
   * 499 Client Disconnect

commit_message:
Let WSGI apps signal that a client connection should be closed

The WSGI spec makes eventlet (as WSGI server) pretty clearly responsible
for connection management, and it errs on the side of allowing
connection reuse, even when the client wants to send a *massive* amount
of data.

Since we've already got our own SwiftHttpProtocol that we pass down
to eventlet, we can use some of eventlet's existing machinery to take
on this decision ourselves. We might want to do this if we expect the
client to send us a *lot* of data that we'd just discard, or if we're
worried about request framing issues.

Update the proxy server to close out the connection whenever it would
respond:

   * 408 Request Timeout,
   * 411 Length Required,
   * 413 Request Entity Too Large, or
   * 499 Client Disconnect

Change-Id: I65919f6e45f537b304f7fda3e015771cec2a9cae

commit_message:
Add warning to ceph-ansible integration docuemtnation

Add a warning making it clear that Wallaby was the
last release with ceph-ansible integration and refer
the reader to the newer Deployed Ceph docuemation.

Change-Id: I8d6ff2cb1e818c36a41ea3c776fece32586ef35a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-docs refs/changes/96/839096/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. warning:: TripleO integration with ceph-ansible became deprecated in Wallaby and support was removed in the next release. TripleO integration with puppet-ceph became deprecated in Pike and support was removed in the next release. For Wallaby and newer use :doc:`deployed_ceph` to have TripleO deploy Ceph. Pike release it became possible to use TripleO to deploy Ceph with `ceph-ansible`_ and puppet-ceph became deprecated.Wallaby is the last release with ceph-ansible integration. Wallaby is also able to deploy a full Ceph cluster, with RBD, RGW, MDS, and Dashboard, using cephadm in place of ceph-ansible as described in :doc:`cephadm`. The preferred way to deploy Ceph with TripleO, in Wallaby and newer, is before the overcloud as described in :doc:`deployed_ceph`.
deleted_lines: Pike release it is possible to use TripleO to deploy Ceph with either `ceph-ansible`_ or puppet-ceph, though puppet-ceph is deprecated. To deploy Ceph in containers use `ceph-ansible`, for which only a containerized Ceph deployment is possible. It is not possible to deploy a containerized Ceph with `puppet-ceph`.Wallaby is the last planned release with ceph-ansible integration. Wallaby is also able to deploy a full Ceph RBD cluster using cephadm in place of ceph-ansible as described in :doc:`cephadm`. TripleO's cephadm integration does not yet support deploying Ceph services like RGW, MDS, and Dashboard.

commit_message:
Simplify tripleo-mount-image examples with --chroot

This change shows how to use the new tripleo-mount-image --chroot to
immediately start a chroot to run image-modifying commands.

Change-Id: Ib631a625617ff19a535734c1e118a78c0eec89b7
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-common/+/838972

added_lines: sudo tripleo-mount-image -a /path/to/overcloud-full.qcow2 --chroot
deleted_lines: temp_dir=$(mktemp -d) sudo tripleo-mount-image -a /path/to/overcloud-full.qcow2 -m $temp_dir sudo mount -o bind /dev $temp_dir/dev/ sudo cp /etc/resolv.conf $temp_dir/etc/resolv.conf sudo chroot $temp_dir /bin/bash - Unmount the image:: sudo rm $temp_dir/etc/resolv.conf sudo umount $temp_dir/dev sudo tripleo-unmount-image -m $temp_dir

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-04-21 13:54:37.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/agent/dhcp/agent.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/agent/dhcp/test_agent.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/ff711bd809b8ce9aec42fcd8e8ca266c90b331d7', 'message': '[DHCP] Break reference chain to any Exception object when resync

In the DHCP agent, if an exception is raised during the driver call,

exception instance was passed instead of a string. This instance
reference was stored in the dictionary "needs_resync_reasons" and
used in "_periodic_resync_helper" to resync the DHCP agent
information.

The call to "sync_state" passed the dictionary ".keys()" method. In
python2.7 when that was implemented, this method was creating a list

commit_message:
[DHCP] Break reference chain to any Exception object when resync

In the DHCP agent, if an exception is raised during the driver call,
"DhcpAgent.schedule_resync" is called. Before this patch, the
exception instance was passed instead of a string. This instance
reference was stored in the dictionary "needs_resync_reasons" and
used in "_periodic_resync_helper" to resync the DHCP agent
information.

The call to "sync_state" passed the dictionary ".keys()" method. In
python2.7 when that was implemented, this method was creating a list
with the dictionary keys. In python3, this method is a generator
that holds the dictionary content.

This patch breaks this reference chain in two points (actually only
one is needed):
- "sync_state" now passes a list created from the mentioned generator.
- The dictionary "needs_resync_reasons" now stores the exception
  strings only, instead of the exception instance.

Closes-Bug: #1969270
Change-Id: I07e9818021283d321fc32066be7e0f8e2b81e639
(cherry picked from commit e3b3ec930967305e5fce314c0a4cf74151ad711c)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/98/838898/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: sync_state.assert_called_once_with(list(resync_reasons.keys())) reasons = list(dhcp.needs_resync_reasons.keys())

[DHCP] Break reference chain to any Exception object when resync

In the DHCP agent, if an exception is raised during the driver call,
"DhcpAgent.schedule_resync" is called. Before this patch, the
exception instance was passed instead of a string. This instance
reference was stored in the dictionary "needs_resync_reasons" and
used in "_periodic_resync_helper" to resync the DHCP agent
information.

python2.7 when that was implemented, this method was creating a list
with the dictionary keys. In python3, this method is a generator

This patch breaks this reference chain in two points (actually only

- "sync_state" now passes a list created from the mentioned generator.

subject: Remove tftp healthcheck from ironic-pxe image
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-03-09 19:49:53.000000000', 'files': ['healthcheck/ironic-pxe'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-common/commit/c3df18a40797e4875dbecbd3b1187eede4c44934', 'message': "Remove tftp healthcheck from ironic-pxe image

This is failing downstream because the installed curl-minimal does not
have tftp support. This healthcheck likely doesn't add much value
since dnsmasq is a self-contained tool which will be bound to the port
if it is running.

The healthcheck for dnsmasq as a DHCP server has already been
removed[1].

The alternative to removing this check is to ensure the 'curl' package
is installed instead of 'curl-minimal'.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-common/+/799946

Change-Id: I126b997608edb217b0fbf40f4228d0f0af689b0e
(cherry picked from commit 1a73f9561ffacf00ebc3b8def2322c835f225afb)
"}]
commit_message:
Remove tftp healthcheck from ironic-pxe image

This is failing downstream because the installed curl-minimal does not
have tftp support. This healthcheck likely doesn't add much value
since dnsmasq is a self-contained tool which will be bound to the port
if it is running.

The healthcheck for dnsmasq as a DHCP server has already been
removed[1].

The alternative to removing this check is to ensure the 'curl' package
is installed instead of 'curl-minimal'.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-common/+/799946

Change-Id: I126b997608edb217b0fbf40f4228d0f0af689b0e
(cherry picked from commit 1a73f9561ffacf00ebc3b8def2322c835f225afb)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-common refs/changes/47/832847/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: exit 0

commit_message:
[DHCP] Break reference chain to any Exception object when resync

In the DHCP agent, if an exception is raised during the driver call,
"DhcpAgent.schedule_resync" is called. Before this patch, the
exception instance was passed instead of a string. This instance
reference was stored in the dictionary "needs_resync_reasons" and
used in "_periodic_resync_helper" to resync the DHCP agent
information.

The call to "sync_state" passed the dictionary ".keys()" method. In
python2.7 when that was implemented, this method was creating a list
with the dictionary keys. In python3, this method is a generator
that holds the dictionary content.

This patch breaks this reference chain in two points (actually only
one is needed):
- "sync_state" now passes a list created from the mentioned generator.
- The dictionary "needs_resync_reasons" now stores the exception
  strings only, instead of the exception instance.

subject: Fix setting table monitoring conditions
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-04-22 14:11:57.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/5c7a536d3a645c0e34da336207393d304b8bfd14', 'message': "Fix setting table monitoring conditions

After the monitor_cond_since/update3 support patch in ovs
(46d44cf3be0), directly setting table.condition is broken. This
isn't something that was every truly supported. Prior to that
patch, using Idl.cond_change() before a connection was made
did not work, but after that patch it does.

This patch uses the old behavior when the OVS library does not
have the ConditionState object, and uses cond_change() otherwise.

Related-Bug: #1965819

commit_message:
Fix setting table monitoring conditions

After the monitor_cond_since/update3 support patch in ovs
(46d44cf3be0), directly setting table.condition is broken. This
isn't something that was every truly supported. Prior to that
patch, using Idl.cond_change() before a connection was made
did not work, but after that patch it does.

This patch uses the old behavior when the OVS library does not
have the ConditionState object, and uses cond_change() otherwise.

Related-Bug: #1965819
Change-Id: I0503037b803a3c99fb7988bc20394c111ac456db
(cherry picked from commit a13a4cb2da03e2cdce04b0e7b4bc30e44ebdbd02)

commit_message:
Drop centos 8 stream testing

In Zed cycle testing runtime, we are targetting the centos 9 stream
- https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/zed.html

With dropping the python 3.6 support, project started adding python 3.8
as minimum, example nova:
- https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/56b5aed08c6a3ed81b78dc216f0165ebfe3c3350/setup.cfg#L13

with that, centos 8 stream job is failing 100%
- https://zuul.openstack.org/build/970d029dc96742c3aa0f6932a35e97cf
- https://zuul.openstack.org/builds?job_name=devstack-platform-centos-8-stream&job_name=tempest-full-py3-centos-8-stream&skip=0

This commit drops centos-8-stream testing and move their job definition
to stable/jobs.yaml file as they are being used on stable branch testing.

Change-Id: Ie72eaaf30ee15710f9fec266e93a6c8ad4eb5ddc

commit_message:
Drop centos 8 stream testing

In Zed cycle testing runtime, we are targetting the centos 9 stream
- https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/zed.html

With dropping the python 3.6 support, project started adding python 3.8
as minimum, example nova:
- https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/56b5aed08c6a3ed81b78dc216f0165ebfe3c3350/setup.cfg#L13

with that, centos 8 stream job is failing 100%
- https://zuul.openstack.org/build/970d029dc96742c3aa0f6932a35e97cf
- https://zuul.openstack.org/builds?job_name=devstack-platform-centos-8-stream&skip=0

This commit drops centos-8-stream testing so that we focus on centos-9-stream.

Change-Id: I045e67b1ca79aba1b2a7be9f88d7804c69c6d781

commit_message:
[FT] Run all .*MySQL tests in an isolated thread

This change in the "dsvm-functional" job definition will avoid the
parallel execution of any MySQL test.

commit_message:
Deny the creation of L7Policies for HTTPS/TCP/UDP listeners

L7Policies are not compatible with non-TERMINATED_HTTPS/HTTP listeners
(i.e HTTPS/TCP/UDP listeners).
The Amphora driver should deny those invalid combinations.

Story: 2007911
Task: 40314

Change-Id: I0f1cac05ebea12a300feffb22fdfe546cf802b87

Spanning tree can add a nice multi-second delay into libvirt
completing the underlying interface binding for a starting VM.
Because of this, It makes sense to disable spanning tree with

Change-Id: If753d3dc613d4358948b2593dd347471e039e6dd
"}]
commit_message:
CI: Turn off STP for CI jobs

Spanning tree can add a nice multi-second delay into libvirt
completing the underlying interface binding for a starting VM.
Because of this, It makes sense to disable spanning tree with
virtual machines so we don't incur the wait which may block
network booting.

Change-Id: If753d3dc613d4358948b2593dd347471e039e6dd
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/25/839425/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: <bridge name='brbm' stp="off"/>

commit_message:
Add check before download "get-pip.py"

In test or dev environment, scripts would be executed serveral times or
more. This patch can speed it up a bit.

Change-Id: I3d7bc98d262d24df1ed711b250eb22d88e9d53b3

commit_message:
Disabling container validation when running redhat-subscription

subscription-manager will fail if run from within a container. Since
some nodes are bindmounting /run, a .containerenv file is exposed
inside /run on the hosts and this breaks subscription-manager on
overcloud nodes.

We can bypass this validation from subscription-manager by enabling the
SMDEV_CONTAINER_OFF environment boolean as described here [1].

Related: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2058540
[1] https://github.com/candlepin/subscription-manager/pull/2652/files

Co-authored-by: Bogdan Dobrelia <bdobreli@redhat.com>
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/ansible-role-redhat-subscription/+/831810
Change-Id: Id23af246cc91fa830c30985437791533e8bd354c
(cherry picked from commit 53d3af77f717ffbe52d629f83e6381d351f113e6)

commit_message:
update external-ceph document with additional settings

Closes-Bug: #1970250
Change-Id: I9f84fb3e786d919e5b1a5df23c57052e5e2ddb84
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible refs/changes/18/839418/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: The ceph configurations should be set for all of the ceph rgw clients found matching ``rgw.clients`` found when listing out all users in your cluster ``ceph auth ls`` along with ``client.rgw.default``. Enable keystone integration in ``globals.yml``: .. code-block:: yaml enable_ceph_rgw_keystone: true # ceph_rgw_keystone_user: ceph_rgw # ceph_rgw_port: 6780 # ceph_rgw_external_fqdn: << kolla_external_fqdn >> # ceph_rgw_internal_fqdn: << kolla_internal_fqdn >> ceph_rgw_swift_compatibility: true ceph_rgw_swift_account_in_url: true # enable_swift: "no" # Feature for swift on disk, not through ceph. enable_swift_s3api: true Enable keystone integration in each of your `rgw ceph clients: <https://docs.ceph.com/en/latest/radosgw/keystone/#integrating-with-openstack-keystone>`__ .. code-block:: console $ sudo ceph config set <client> rgw_keystone_api_version 3 $ sudo ceph config set <client> rgw_keystone_url https://<$internal_url>:35357 $ sudo ceph config set <client> rgw_keystone_accepted_admin_roles "admin, ResellerAdmin" $ sudo ceph config set <client> rgw_keystone_accepted_roles "_member_, member, admin, ResellerAdmin" $ sudo ceph config set <client> rgw_keystone_implicit_tenants true $ sudo ceph config set <client> rgw_keystone_admin_user ceph_rgw $ sudo ceph config set <client> rgw_keystone_admin_password <ceph_rgw_pass from the passwords.yml> $ sudo ceph config set <client> rgw_keystone_admin_project service $ sudo ceph config set <client> rgw_keystone_admin_domain default $ sudo ceph config set <client> rgw_keystone_verify_ssl false # Useful for self-signed certificates $ sudo ceph config set <client> rgw_content_length_compat true $ sudo ceph config set <client> rgw_enable_apis "s3, swift, swift_auth, admin" $ sudo ceph config set <client> rgw_s3_auth_use_keystone true $ sudo ceph config set <client> rgw_enforce_swift_acls true $ sudo ceph config set <client> rgw_swift_account_in_url true $ sudo ceph config set <client> rgw_swift_versioning_enabled true $ sudo ceph config set <client> rgw_verify_ssl false enable_ceph_rgw_loadbalancer: true6780. The port listed above should match the port used in your ceph rgw deployment, for example, if using a trivial deployment ``sudo ceph orch apply rgw foo --port=7480``, the port above should be `7480` instead of port `8080`.

Use tryint() for stats value

the conversion to integer does not work.

commit_message:
Fix setting table monitoring conditions

After the monitor_cond_since/update3 support patch in ovs
(46d44cf3be0), directly setting table.condition is broken. This
isn't something that was every truly supported. Prior to that
patch, using Idl.cond_change() before a connection was made
did not work, but after that patch it does.

This patch uses the old behavior when the OVS library does not
have the ConditionState object, and uses cond_change() otherwise.

Related-Bug: #1965819
Change-Id: I0503037b803a3c99fb7988bc20394c111ac456db
(cherry picked from commit a13a4cb2da03e2cdce04b0e7b4bc30e44ebdbd02)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/84/838784/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from ovs.db import idl as ovs_idl_mod def set_table_condition(self, table_name, condition): # Prior to ovs commit 46d44cf3be0, self.cond_change() doesn't work here # but after that commit, setting table.condtion doesn't work. if hasattr(ovs_idl_mod, 'ConditionState'): self.cond_change(table_name, condition) else: # Can be removed after the minimum ovs version >= 2.17.0 self.tables[table_name].condition = condition self.set_table_condition( 'Port_Group', [['name', '==', ovn_const.OVN_DROP_PORT_GROUP_NAME]])
deleted_lines: # self.cond_change() doesn't work here because we are setting the # condition *before an initial monitor request is made* so there is # no previous session whose condition we wish to change self.tables['Port_Group'].condition = [ ['name', '==', ovn_const.OVN_DROP_PORT_GROUP_NAME]]

commit_message:
Fix no_proxy configuration

The no_proxy list should only contain domains, hostnames, IP addresses
and networks, but docker_registry is often in the form ip_address:port.

Use urlsplit to extract the hostname from the docker_registry variable
after prepending http:// to turn it into a valid URL.

Also add missing infra-vms to hosts in proxy.yml.

Change-Id: I6424fc405894514a63fb2b641637bbb9d5c070c0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kayobe refs/changes/04/838404/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: # used. Defaults to ["127.0.0.1", "localhost", "{{ docker_registry }}"]. This # is configured only if either http_proxy or https_proxy is set.

commit_message:
In AIO and CI set the internal vip to https only for 'deploy' actions.

This means that an 'upgrade' action (and therefore upgrade CI job) will
deploy the internal VIP as http as a starting point for the upgrade.

Change-Id: Ifa52850269373600c5bfa59f760f0480ab2347d1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/31/830431/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: {% if bootstrap_host_action == 'deploy' %}{% endif %}

commit_message:
Fix the CI

Lower constraints do not cap all dependencies, causing incompatibilities.
Update Jinja2 to 2.11.3 (the last pre-3.0 version) and downgrade
MarkupSafe, Werkzeug and itsdangerous for Flask.

Something must have changed in one of the dependencies, and the Location
header is no longer returning the host in the URL.

Remove subunit and testscenarios, we don't use them directly.

Change-Id: I5bad754ef7b1bec6986c2b4293a38226c5a261af

commit_message:
do not include [*-feature-enabled] sections in tempest.conf

We should not include [*-feature-enabled] sections in tempest.conf and use
``tempest_tempest_conf_overrides`` for these customizations instead.

There is no way we can keep feature list updated all the time and cover all
possible features in defaults/main.yml.
That's why I think we shouldn't cover them here at all.

If we need these customizations for testing purposed(tested it and I think we
don't), we should define them using ``tempest_tempest_conf_overrides`` only for
these tests.

Change-Id: If7d7ca5ae76cb3cb24f95fb9608ce3e1182d5e5a
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/openstack-ansible/+/825166

commit_message:
[Docs] Update role maturity matrix

With the arrival of new roles, lots of updates on the existing
ones and the role maturity matrix builder not yet completed [1],
this patch updates the status of the role maturity matrix.

Retired roles are also being updated/added for informative purposes
only.

commit_message:
Retrieve stack owner to enable retrict user access to stack related

  One of usecases could be restricting access to stack heat
template due to sensitive data is stored in a template.
Having stack owner would allow operator to restrict access to
the stack template with simple generic policy.

Change-Id: I691a9f0be37ac5954bad19d0492887fd8404a57a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/25/804425/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Fix setting table monitoring conditions

After the monitor_cond_since/update3 support patch in ovs
(46d44cf3be0), directly setting table.condition is broken. This
isn't something that was every truly supported. Prior to that
patch, using Idl.cond_change() before a connection was made
did not work, but after that patch it does.

This patch uses the old behavior when the OVS library does not
have the ConditionState object, and uses cond_change() otherwise.

Related-Bug: #1965819
Change-Id: I0503037b803a3c99fb7988bc20394c111ac456db
(cherry picked from commit a13a4cb2da03e2cdce04b0e7b4bc30e44ebdbd02)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/83/838783/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from ovs.db import idl as ovs_idl_mod def set_table_condition(self, table_name, condition): # Prior to ovs commit 46d44cf3be0, self.cond_change() doesn't work here # but after that commit, setting table.condtion doesn't work. if hasattr(ovs_idl_mod, 'ConditionState'): self.cond_change(table_name, condition) else: # Can be removed after the minimum ovs version >= 2.17.0 self.tables[table_name].condition = condition self.set_table_condition( 'Port_Group', [['name', '==', ovn_const.OVN_DROP_PORT_GROUP_NAME]])
deleted_lines: # self.cond_change() doesn't work here because we are setting the # condition *before an initial monitor request is made* so there is # no previous session whose condition we wish to change self.tables['Port_Group'].condition = [ ['name', '==', ovn_const.OVN_DROP_PORT_GROUP_NAME]]

commit_message:
Do not announce any DNS resolver if "0.0.0.0" or "::" provided

The DHCP server should not announce any DNS resolver at all on the
subnet if "0.0.0.0" (IPv4) or "::" (IPv6) are configured as DNS
name servers in any subnet.

https://docs.openstack.org/neutron/latest/admin/config-dns-res.html

Cherry-picked from Neutron(master):
  https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/820858

Closes-Bug: #1950686

(manually cherry-picked from  a416f8b0ab810f34ea274183df590a73d150a137)

Change-Id: Id8b9bd8fe866b1bb82559a7d1ec558f68d7d1836

added_lines: from os import path from neutron_lib import constants as n_const from oslo_config import cfgRESOLV_DNS_SERVERS = ['10.0.0.1', '10.0.0.3'] expected_dns_resolvers = RESOLV_DNS_SERVERS class TestGetDhcpDnsServers(base.TestCase): def test_ipv4(self): # DNS servers from subnet. dns_servers = utils.get_dhcp_dns_servers( {'dns_nameservers': ['1.2.3.4', '5.6.7.8']}) self.assertEqual(['1.2.3.4', '5.6.7.8'], dns_servers) # DNS servers from config parameter. cfg.CONF.set_override('dns_servers', '1.1.2.2,3.3.4.4', group='ovn') dns_servers = utils.get_dhcp_dns_servers({}) self.assertEqual(['1.1.2.2', '3.3.4.4'], dns_servers) # DNS servers from local DNS resolver. cfg.CONF.set_override('dns_servers', '', group='ovn') with mock.patch('builtins.open', mock.mock_open(read_data=RESOLV_CONF_TEMPLATE)), \ mock.patch.object(path, 'exists', return_value=True): dns_servers = utils.get_dhcp_dns_servers({}) self.assertEqual(RESOLV_DNS_SERVERS, dns_servers) # No DNS servers if only '0.0.0.0' configured. dns_servers = utils.get_dhcp_dns_servers( {'dns_nameservers': ['0.0.0.0', '5.6.7.8']}) self.assertEqual(['0.0.0.0', '5.6.7.8'], dns_servers) dns_servers = utils.get_dhcp_dns_servers( {'dns_nameservers': ['0.0.0.0']}) self.assertEqual([], dns_servers) def test_ipv6(self): # DNS servers from subnet. dns_servers = utils.get_dhcp_dns_servers( {'dns_nameservers': ['2001:4860:4860::8888', '2001:4860:4860::8844']}, ip_version=n_const.IP_VERSION_6) self.assertEqual(['2001:4860:4860::8888', '2001:4860:4860::8844'], dns_servers) # No DNS servers if only '::' configured. dns_servers = utils.get_dhcp_dns_servers( {'dns_nameservers': ['2001:4860:4860::8888', '::']}, ip_version=n_const.IP_VERSION_6) self.assertEqual(['2001:4860:4860::8888', '::'], dns_servers) dns_servers = utils.get_dhcp_dns_servers( {'dns_nameservers': ['::']}, ip_version=n_const.IP_VERSION_6) self.assertEqual([], dns_servers)

commit_message:
Add functionality to accept both HTTP and HTTPS during upgrade

Enable TLS on internal communication has 2 parts
* Enabling TLS on the internal VIPs for haproxy frontends
* Enabling TLS on the service backends
Haproxy has support for enabling TLS on frontends and backends,
but doing so would cause downtime.

In the case of upgrading frontends, enabling TLS would prevent
openstack services from working until their config is changed
from http to https, as they do not follow redirects.

In the case of backends haproxy would mark each backend as down
because if could not initiate a HTTPS connection to the backend
until the backend is updated.

This patch fixes this and allows haproxy to accept both HTTP and
HTTPS on the same well known port for each service. It also
allows for both HTTP and HTTPS backends.

Support for HTTP and HTTPS on the frontend is enabled by setting
haproxy_tcp_upgrade_frontend: true

Support for HTTP and HTTPS on the backend is enabled by setting
haproxy_tcp_upgrade_backend: true

This is a temporary patch and will be removed once instances have
been upgraded to HTTPS for internal communications in a future
release of OSA.

Change-Id: I4279005d5b4e6133cf85ba43379b51149c838f17

subject: [OVN] Handle OVN agents when "Chassis" register is deleted
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-04-22 09:02:17.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/functional/plugins/ml2/drivers/ovn/mech_driver/test_mech_driver.py', 'neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/ovn/agent/neutron_agent.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/9b8a75f6e7f48c964b5af68f3caa94dedd98ef92', 'message': '[OVN] Handle OVN agents when "Chassis" register is deleted

If an "ovn-controller" ends not gracefully, the node "Chassis" and
"Chassis_Private" registers will remain in the OVN SB database.
Because there is no a mandatory procedure to delete the "Chassis"
and "Chassis_Private" registers, the administrator can manually
delete, from the OVN SB database, any register in any order.

If the "Chassis" register is deleted and the Neutron server restarted,
the updated "Chassis_Private" register will be read from the database.
That won't contain the "Chassis" information as this register has been
deleted. In this case, the ``NeutronAgent`` returns ``DeletedChassis``,
an empty chassis register with no information.

NOTE: the sequence of actions ("Chassis" register deletion, Neutron
server restart) must be follow to reproduce this issue. If the
"Chassis" register is deleted, the Neutron server OVN agent local cache
won't update the stored information and will keep the previous value.
It is when the Neutron server is restarted when the OVN agent local
cache is retrieved again; at this time the "Chassis_Private" register
won't have any related "Chassis" register.

Closes-Bug: #1951149

Change-Id: I17aa53cea6aba8ea83187c99102a6f25fd33cfff
(cherry picked from commit f1a5511e9094d6aae7a61cd858c59c706033ca95)
'}]
commit_message:
[OVN] Handle OVN agents when "Chassis" register is deleted

If an "ovn-controller" ends not gracefully, the node "Chassis" and
"Chassis_Private" registers will remain in the OVN SB database.
Because there is no a mandatory procedure to delete the "Chassis"
and "Chassis_Private" registers, the administrator can manually
delete, from the OVN SB database, any register in any order.

If the "Chassis" register is deleted and the Neutron server restarted,
the updated "Chassis_Private" register will be read from the database.
That won't contain the "Chassis" information as this register has been
deleted. In this case, the ``NeutronAgent`` returns ``DeletedChassis``,
an empty chassis register with no information.

NOTE: the sequence of actions ("Chassis" register deletion, Neutron
server restart) must be follow to reproduce this issue. If the
"Chassis" register is deleted, the Neutron server OVN agent local cache
won't update the stored information and will keep the previous value.
It is when the Neutron server is restarted when the OVN agent local
cache is retrieved again; at this time the "Chassis_Private" register
won't have any related "Chassis" register.

Closes-Bug: #1951149

won't update the stored information and will keep the previous value.

cache is retrieved again; at this time the "Chassis_Private" register
won't have any related "Chassis" register.

commit_message:
[OVN] Handle OVN agents when "Chassis" register is deleted

If an "ovn-controller" ends not gracefully, the node "Chassis" and
"Chassis_Private" registers will remain in the OVN SB database.
Because there is no a mandatory procedure to delete the "Chassis"
and "Chassis_Private" registers, the administrator can manually
delete, from the OVN SB database, any register in any order.

If the "Chassis" register is deleted and the Neutron server restarted,
the updated "Chassis_Private" register will be read from the database.
That won't contain the "Chassis" information as this register has been
deleted. In this case, the ``NeutronAgent`` returns ``DeletedChassis``,
an empty chassis register with no information.

NOTE: the sequence of actions ("Chassis" register deletion, Neutron
server restart) must be follow to reproduce this issue. If the
"Chassis" register is deleted, the Neutron server OVN agent local cache
won't update the stored information and will keep the previous value.
It is when the Neutron server is restarted when the OVN agent local
cache is retrieved again; at this time the "Chassis_Private" register
won't have any related "Chassis" register.

Closes-Bug: #1951149

Change-Id: I17aa53cea6aba8ea83187c99102a6f25fd33cfff
(cherry picked from commit f1a5511e9094d6aae7a61cd858c59c706033ca95)

commit_message:
[fwaas] Remove secgroup creation related methods

As tempest.scenario.manager was announced stable interface in Tempest
27.0.0[1] it can be now reused in plugins.

Replaced methods:
    * _create_security_group
    * _create_empty_security_group
    * _default_security_group (not in tempest anymore)
    * _create_security_group_rule
    * _create_loginable_secgroup_rule

Etherpad concerning this effort:
https://etherpad.opendev.org/p/tempest-scenario-manager-cleanup

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/releasenotes/tempest/v27.0.0.html#release-notes-27-0-0

Change-Id: I82f69070fa7a873bce95ef7fb57341d38b1b829e

commit_message:
Migrate ssl certificate generation to the PKI role

This is now common functionality in an ansible role, rather than
being implemented directly in openstack-ansible service roles.

This patch creates the apache server certificate and key using the
pki role when keystone_ssl is true.

A CA certificate and key are generated and installed when keystone
is configured to be an IDP, triggered by keystone_idp.certfile being
defined.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/ansible-role-pki/+/830794
Change-Id: Ie70aecc93b8acb7c1bbad02e98254b7c50c4c86f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_keystone refs/changes/79/830179/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # The local address used for the keystone node keystone_node_address: "{{ management_address | default(127.0.0.1) }}" # Storage location for SSL certificate authority keystone_pki_dir: "{{ openstack_pki_dir }}" # Delegated host for operating the certificate authority keystone_pki_setup_host: "{{ openstack_pki_setup_host | default('localhost') }}" keystone_pki_keys_path: "{{ keystone_pki_dir ~ '/certs/private/' }}" keystone_pki_certs_path: "{{ keystone_pki_dir ~ '/certs/certs/' }}" keystone_pki_intermediate_cert_name: "{{ openstack_pki_service_intermediate_cert_name }}" keystone_pki_intermediate_cert_path: "{{ keystone_pki_dir ~ '/roots/' ~ keystone_pki_intermediate_cert_name ~ '/certs/' ~ keystone_pki_intermediate_cert_name ~ '.crt' }}" keystone_pki_regen_cert: '' keystone_pki_certificates: - name: "keystone_{{ ansible_facts['hostname'] }}" provider: ownca cn: "{{ ansible_facts['hostname'] }}" san: "{{ 'DNS:' ~ ansible_facts['hostname'] ~ ',IP:' ~ keystone_node_address }}" signed_by: "{{ keystone_pki_intermediate_cert_name }}" # keystone destination files for SSL certificates # Installation details for SSL certificates keystone_pki_install_certificates: - src: "{{ keystone_user_ssl_cert | default(keystone_pki_certs_path ~ 'keystone_' ~ ansible_facts['hostname'] ~ '.crt') }}" dest: "{{ keystone_ssl_cert }}" owner: "keystone_system_user_name" group: "keystone_system_group_name" mode: "0644" - src: "{{ keystone_user_ssl_key | default(keystone_pki_keys_path ~ 'keystone_' ~ ansible_facts['hostname'] ~ '.key.pem') }}" dest: "{{ keystone_ssl_key }}" owner: "keystone_system_user_name" group: "keystone_system_group_name" mode: "0600" - src: "{{ keystone_user_ssl_ca_cert | default(keystone_pki_intermediate_cert_path) }}" dest: "{{ keystone_ssl_ca_cert }}" owner: "keystone_system_user_name" group: "keystone_system_group_name" mode: "0644"

commit_message:
[fwaas] Remove _create_port & create_keypair

As tempest.scenario.manager was announced stable interface in Tempest
27.0.0[1] it can be now reused in plugins.

Replaced methods:
    * _create_port
    * create_keypair

Etherpad concerning this effort:
https://etherpad.opendev.org/p/tempest-scenario-manager-cleanup

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/releasenotes/tempest/v27.0.0.html#release-notes-27-0-0

commit_message:
Add a new option to enforce the OpenSSL FIPS mode

This option ``ssl_enforce_fips_mode`` allow us to enforce the FIPS mode
if supported by the version of python in use.

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Federal_Information_Processing_Standards

Change-Id: I50c7de71bfd38137eb83d23e910298946507ce9f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.messaging refs/changes/74/797874/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: cfg.BoolOpt('ssl_enforce_fips_mode', default=False, help='Enforce the OpenSSL FIPS mode if supported by the ' 'python version' ) if self.ssl_enforce_fips_mode: try getattr(ssl, 'FIPS_mode') except AttributeError: LOG.warning( "OpenSSL FIPS mode is not supported by your python " "version. If you see this message that mean " "your tried to enforce the FIPS mode without success " "If you want to use it you should consider to patch " "and compile your python version. That will enabled " "the support. For now The execution will continue " "without enforcing this mode, however, if you try to " "use a hash that is not FIPS-compliant Python will " "crash") else: LOG.info("Enforcing the use of the OpenSSL FIPS mode") ssl.FIPS_mode_set(1)

commit_message:
Do not deploy api-paste for CentOS distro deployment

RDO stopped shipping api-paste file for glance, so we can't provide it
anymore. To avoid maintaining it for this usecase we simply stop
provisioning as well for this path.

Change-Id: I9ba7f373e16a16d13f3a42484931a6f67dcfca89

commit_message:
Fix node delete for unprovision confirmation

We changed the unprovision confirmation file structure to
include pre-provisioned nodes[1].  This fixes node delete
for that.

[1] Id377b2c7ed973a7e2365b33dba2c1d59a59e26b9

Change-Id: Id5b5e257679ce7fca26e1ebf272988eaab2d4d53

commit_message:
Use Rocky release of Heat in Queens job

The oldest branch in Heat repository is stable/rocky. Previously,
Zuul CI would use the master branch of Heat since it could not find
stable/queens branch but master branch has incompatibilities with
our Queens job.

Change-Id: Iaeca759cad641d4923fc63489fd65f57d9f1345a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ansible-collections-openstack refs/changes/35/839335/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Implement nova direct RBD image retrieve

When nova don't use rbd images (ie local storage) it still might be good
idea to use direct connection to rbd to get images rather then
connect through HTTP.

Change-Id: I4f2d7cf54e07376c7a25d45093f5d83be5422234
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_nova refs/changes/97/828897/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: nova_ceph_client: "{{ cinder_ceph_client }}"# Enable compute nodes to retrieve images from RBD directly rather then through # HTTP if images_type is NOT set to RBD. Must be False if nova images stored in RBD. nova_glance_rbd_inuse: False nova_glance_images_rbd_pool: "{{ glance_rbd_store_pool | default('images') }}"

commit_message:
Setup db/mq/service during scheduler run

According to our playbook, role runs against api last, after scheduler,
volume and backup services are already setup.

It makes difference only when cinder-scheduler and cinder-api are
deployed to different targets.

Change-Id: I18f68b5cb9dd60d9cf72850e840d0459e1245b76

commit_message:
Use constant constants.ANSIBLE_INVENTORY for setting inventory default path

parser object doesnt contains parser args, so using parser.output_dir
is not working as expected.
This patch use the constants.ANSIBLE_INVENTORY for getting the full path
for inventory.

Closes-Bug: #1970387
Change-Id: I2d06ae77efbd3f71147d052fc11acea550c831aa

commit_message:
Inventory for validations

Changes in the way cloud inventory is generated have left
validation framework without a reliable inventory access.

This patch sets default inventory path to constant defined in client code.

Resolves: rhbz#2050765
Closes-Bug: #1970387

Signed-off-by: Jiri Podivin <jpodivin@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I4fa7041bca1b8cca58a999348ed0f1ab1480ffd5

commit_message:
DNM: Experiments profiling Octavia

Since the octavia processes are long-running services, and
there are multiple worker processes, I had to come
up with a trick. I now use yappi in a separate thread that saves
the profiling results a certain time after the service started.

The results that I got so far did not show a bottleneck yet.

Change-Id: I35ae4f4bbf825b94c5373728fce6ac1429b793a9
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/octavia refs/changes/41/830441/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import threadingdef profthread(): import time, os, yappi yappi.start() time.sleep(2000) yappi.get_func_stats().save(f"/tmp/yappi-api-{os.getpid()}.prof", type="pstat") t = threading.Thread(target=profthread) t.start()

commit_message:
Log Global Request IDs by default

Global Request IDs were introduced a while ago[1] so that operators can
trace processing of resources across multiple services more easily.

Some services like Nova or Neutron have implemented this feature and
a request made by these services have additional global request id in
its context. However current default format doesn't include that new id
and users need to update the log format parameter in each service to
get this information recorded.

This change updates the default log format so that the Global Request
IDs can be more widely and easily used.

[1] https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/oslo-specs/specs/pike/global-req-id.html

Change-Id: I1adc9b29bb356ce56704c066b375b49374200d3c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.log refs/changes/90/838190/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- upgrade: - | Default value of the ``[DEFAULT] logging_context_format_string`` option has been updated and now Global Request IDs are logged by default.

commit_message:
Move dns zone info to use proxy layer

Make it compatible with new SDK.
Although this one was already using self.con.dns.zones to retrieve the
zones, it wasn't using the to_dict(computed=False) and was still
removing the location (which is obsolate when you use to_dict.

Change-Id: Ie2a5b772acc0c8c8338f6f1da877564a077e3b7a

added_lines: data = [zone.to_dict(computed=False) for zone in self.conn.dns.zones(**kwargs)]
deleted_lines: data = [] for raw in self.conn.dns.zones(**kwargs): dt = raw.to_dict() dt.pop('location') data.append(dt)

commit_message:
Install jss-5.0.3 in freeipa installation

Currently ss-5.2.0-0.2 is causing issues while deploying
freeipa.

Installing jss-5.0.3 fixes the issue.

Related-Bug: #1969613

Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar (raukadah) <chkumar@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I81195d6b93162619e367a570ab148ff324a98a5d

subject: Move image validation into extract-image
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-04-26 03:53:47.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/diskimage-builder/commit/44de5e236890262f66e244a4b371883a4c497bf1', 'message': "Move image validation into extract-image

I noticed in a recent failure that after
I73d6323aa65cee69a55e54bc53ed682f096dfc89 we are now downloading and
using the image file and *then* verifying the checksum; defeating the
purpose of having the checksum.

commit_message:
Move image validation into extract-image

I noticed in a recent failure that after
I73d6323aa65cee69a55e54bc53ed682f096dfc89 we are now downloading and
using the image file and *then* verifying the checksum; defeating the
purpose of having the checksum.

Move this into extract-image directly.  I made the input a
free-formish string so we can expand it to take different forms of
arguments, but just implemented a simple download+check file combo to
start.  Other users are patched up for the new argument as
appropriate.

I also turned up the default debugging level of this script as I don't
think we need too much info from it by default.

Change-Id: I291627d485a6ee23c74b4eec11380e927748f033

commit_message:
[L3][QoS] Remove router QoS binding when GW is removed

Now when the external gateway of a router is removed, the QoS policy
assigned to this router is removed too. A router can only have a QoS
policy assigned if a gateway port is attached; if the port is removed,
the QoS binding must be removed too.

Closes-Bug: #1968269
Change-Id: Iced254259170972a9699aa35ae8062776e11285d
(cherry picked from commit 8ad6c3bf60081ebf19c1cadd9c46e1f5bf504892)

commit_message:
OVN: Clean up deprecated parameters

The ovn_l3_mode parameter[1] and the vif_type parameter[2] were
deprecated during Wallaby cycle, so these are ready to be removed.

[1] 4f09774c6b47375533ef6120d5418172137c4c2d
[2] 1ba7a40514850b059afbfc22da90cfea33ceaab5

Change-Id: I29083f796d6ee0436785310210b7eb84af1ee5d4

subject: Move reset-bls-entries to post-install
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-04-20 22:22:33.000000000', 'files': ['diskimage_builder/elements/rhel/post-install.d/03-reset-bls-entries', 'diskimage_builder/elements/centos/post-install.d/03-reset-bls-entries'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/diskimage-builder/commit/e129fad7f8b4d051c64f32b49e5308816c7112d3', 'message': "Move reset-bls-entries to post-install

03-reset-bls-entries was previously a pre-install script to run after
the machine-id was set, but a new kernel may be installed during the
install phase, which will install another bls entry file with a
filename which differs from the machine-id.

This means this package installed bls file won't be updated when
grub2-mkconfig is called, resulting in incorrect kernel args and boot
device in the entry file that will get booted by default.

By fixing the filenames after the new kernel is installed,
grub2-mkconfig will update the bls file that actually gets used on
boot.

Change-Id: I653bef9638e38ded68458fd40d90e30e5206caad
"}]
commit_message:
Move reset-bls-entries to post-install

03-reset-bls-entries was previously a pre-install script to run after
the machine-id was set, but a new kernel may be installed during the
install phase, which will install another bls entry file with a
filename which differs from the machine-id.

This means this package installed bls file won't be updated when
grub2-mkconfig is called, resulting in incorrect kernel args and boot
device in the entry file that will get booted by default.

By fixing the filenames after the new kernel is installed,
grub2-mkconfig will update the bls file that actually gets used on
boot.

Change-Id: I653bef9638e38ded68458fd40d90e30e5206caad

Remove deprecated gateway_external_network_id

... because it was deprecated several cycles ago[1] and has had no
effect since then. The parameter was already removed from Neutron[2].

[1] a962699bc711570162c004467558ea6837fc5582
[2] 9b2e472ae971498016337c7bcedbe9cbbcc434a8

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-04-11 04:16:34.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/diskimage-builder/commit/ba6ea676787415969e9f1054c9cc776971d54787', 'message': 'yum-minimal: clean up release package installs

Iecf7f7e4c992bb23437b6461cdd04cdca96aafa6.  However it didn't really
explain why these are brought in here.

Reading further it became clearer that over the years of distribution
additions, Fedora updates, etc. this has grown into a bit of a mess.

Refactor the release package installs into a more logical flow,
pulling out checks/comments for Fedora's of ancient history, etc.
Remove the 9-stream package installs; this isn't the place for them,
and the should be brought in by the base packages.

Ultimately, this is intendend to a be a no-op refactor.

commit_message:
yum-minimal: clean up release package installs

This started a long way from here, when I noticed that "top" on centos
9-stream images wasn't working because ncurses-base wasn't installed.

This led me to the extant install of bash/glibc/ncurses-libs from
Iecf7f7e4c992bb23437b6461cdd04cdca96aafa6.  However it didn't really
explain why these are brought in here.

Reading further it became clearer that over the years of distribution
additions, Fedora updates, etc. this has grown into a bit of a mess.

Refactor the release package installs into a more logical flow,
pulling out checks/comments for Fedora's of ancient history, etc.
Remove the 9-stream package installs; this isn't the place for them,
and the should be brought in by the base packages.

Ultimately, this is intendend to a be a no-op refactor.

Change-Id: Ie7d9a6497d0d20a3303ec0da3d0668c74efa2c3d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/diskimage-builder refs/changes/48/837248/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if [[ ${DISTRO_NAME} = fedora ]]; then packages+=" fedora-repos fedora-gpg-keys" elif [[ ${DISTRO_NAME} = centos && ${DIB_RELEASE%-stream} -gt 7 ]]; then elif [[ ${DISTRO_NAME} == 'openeuler' ]]; then packages+="openEuler-release " else # NOTE(ianw) 2022-04-11 : this fallback is probably # insufficient as the time writing this comment (it was # probably relevant in like fedora < 20 and centos 6 era). It # would probably be better to hard fail here, but for now just # leave it until we have a problem. packages+="${DISTRO_NAME}-release "
deleted_lines: if [[ ${DISTRO_NAME} = fedora && ${DIB_RELEASE} -gt 29 ]]; then elif [[ ${DISTRO_NAME} == 'centos' && ${DIB_RELEASE} = '9-stream' ]]; then packages+="bash glibc ncurses-libs " elif [[ ${DISTRO_NAME} == 'openeuler' ]]; then packages+="openEuler-release " else packages+="${DISTRO_NAME}-release " fi # Starting in F21 this was split into a separate package if [[ ${DISTRO_NAME} == 'fedora' ]]; then packages+="fedora-repos " fi # F27 started putting gpg keys into this separate package if [[ ${DISTRO_NAME} = fedora && ${DIB_RELEASE} -gt 26 ]]; then packages+="fedora-gpg-keys " fi # CentOS 8.1 split repositories and GPG keys out into subpackages if [[ ${DISTRO_NAME} = centos && ${DIB_RELEASE%-stream} -gt 7 ]]; then fi # For openEuler, install other required repos and gpy-keys packages. if [[ ${DISTRO_NAME} == 'openeuler' ]]; then

commit_message:
Correct zaza dependencies

Change Iadd11634d1fe44731ecf0a6104561b4aeebff23f errantly landed the
patch with the src/test-requirements.txt pointing to a non-official zaza
branch for testing purposes.

This reverts the part of the dependencies to point to the correct and
official zaza repositories.

Change-Id: I764efe462fa1933f3c13aed91acfb203248ac9b1

commit_message:
statsd: Add support for host and port

This change introduces support for the following two parameters.
 - [statsd] host
 - [statsd] port

commit_message:
Limit installation of new version of paramiko library

There seems to be an issue with newer version of paramiko library
that causes problems in some tempest tests [1] and
barbican-tempest-plugin tests as well.
The issue probably appeared with the paramiko version 2.9.1.

This patch prevents from paramiko version 2.9.1 and higher being
installed. This should by only temporary solution until the real
cause of the paramiko related error is disovered.

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/tempest/+bug/1960692

Change-Id: Ia11d79e3fb134f2bc42d61264b2d16b94c6ba641
Related-Bug: 1960692

commit_message:
cs9: Do not enable advanced virtualization repository

The advanced virtualization repository is not available for CentOS
Stream 9. This change disables the repository by default accordingly.

Closes-Bug: #1969484
Change-Id: If888cf4f37a625f54ba89ae40a4f30e76c11987e

We need to evaluate the expression otherwise bash tries to execute it
and it causes the following error in the logs:

   ++ /opt/stack/zun/devstack/lib/zun:upload_images:139 :   docker == docker
   docker: '==' is not a docker command.
   See 'docker --help'

Change-Id: I2f1ce306e3eddaa4f583b25b324e8d78f3037261
"}]
commit_message:
Devstack: Fix bash conditional in upload_images

We need to evaluate the expression otherwise bash tries to execute it
and it causes the following error in the logs:

   ++ /opt/stack/zun/devstack/lib/zun:upload_images:139 :   docker == docker
   docker: '==' is not a docker command.
   See 'docker --help'

Change-Id: I2f1ce306e3eddaa4f583b25b324e8d78f3037261

commit_message:
support tls when connect to docker via websocket
1. add docker_remote_ws_url option to choose ws or wss
2. enable tls when conenct to docker if api_insecure is False

Signed-off-by: yue.lg <yuelg@chinaunicom.cn>
Change-Id: I758830fdda8c75a280bbf192f68a55b967581140
Signed-off-by: yue.lg <yuelg@chinaunicom.cn>

commit_message:
Revert "Add tag to port more earlier"

This reverts commit c63ebef2d58e15f4388cf064066f77b503a2f841.

Reason for revert: It seems that this change breaks one of
the tempest scenario tests from the tempest-slow job.

Change-Id: I64d17378053491a5c5f4e77bc67c9452beeaf9a3
Related-bug: #1968896

commit_message:
[Train-only] Capping validations-libs at 1.6.*

Validations-libs stable/1.6 branch is intended to be used by
stable/train branches in Openstack. Setting the constraint
should prevent incompatible versions from being pulled.

Related-Bug: #1967277

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/requirements/+/837263

Signed-off-by: Jiri Podivin <jpodivin@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Icf7b0172abfa972f5abe4c88e4c88a751db654be

subject: Fix validate error when k8s resource init
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-04-08 04:45:07.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tacker/commit/f2d4057bd377ee10943654bbb1ce1ce6b13a3558', 'message': 'Fix validate error when k8s resource init
Since the k8s version has been upgraded from v22.6.0 to v23.3.0,
the initial value of some fields must be the specified string,
which causes the initialization of the current k8s resource to fail.

This patch fixes the issue and skips the validation of k8s object
initialization by setting the `client_side_validation` parameter.
In order to pass the validation, the must_param variable was added
to set the initialized value. This modification skips the
validation and no longer uses the variable, so the related processing
of the variable is deleted.

At the same time, due to the rapid iteration of the k8s version,
the must_param variable needs to be repaired in each iteration to
adapt to the new validation, which requires repeated maintenance
and high maintenance costs, so it is no longer used.

Closes-Bug: #1968103
Change-Id: I9495ce0f0893e5f9a1d6c52b98c3db3928bd95a3
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2022-04-08 05:10:52.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tacker/commit/8f46814b053de176490ad986f74744434dd01972', 'message': 'Fix validate error when k8s resource init

In order to pass the validation, the must_param variable was added
to set the initialized value. This modification skips the
validation and no longer uses the variable, so the related processing
of the variable is deleted.

At the same time, due to the rapid iteration of the k8s version,
the must_param variable needs to be repaired in each iteration to
adapt to the new validation, which requires repeated maintenance
and high maintenance costs, so it is no longer used.

Closes-Bug: #1968103
Change-Id: I9495ce0f0893e5f9a1d6c52b98c3db3928bd95a3
'}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2022-04-08 07:48:19.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tacker/commit/ae1e7f1abc6f235d147ab2e88dd8aba763e9f112', 'message': "Fix validate error when k8s resource init

Since the k8s version has been upgraded from v22.6.0 to v23.3.0,
the initial value of some fields must be the specified string,
which causes the initialization of the current k8s resource to fail.

This patch fixes the issue and skips the validation of k8s object
initialization by setting the `client_side_validation` parameter.
In order to pass the validation, the must_param variable was added
to set the initialized value. This modification skips the
validation and no longer uses the variable, so the related processing
of the variable is deleted. At the same time, even if the
initialization validation is skipped, the fields in the yaml file
will still be verified when the create method is called, and an
exception will be thrown and output to the log if the fields are
missing.

At the same time, due to the rapid iteration of the k8s version,
the must_param variable needs to be repaired in each iteration to
adapt to the new validation, which requires repeated maintenance
and high maintenance costs, so it is no longer used.

In kubernetes v23.3.0, 'available_replicas' must be set into status
of `StatefulSet`, so this patch added this attribute into statefulset
yaml used in FT.

Closes-Bug: #1968103
Change-Id: I9495ce0f0893e5f9a1d6c52b98c3db3928bd95a3

commit_message:
Fix validate error when k8s resource init

This patch fixes the issue that k8s failed to initialize object due
to version upgrade. Skip initial validation by setting the
`client_side_validation` parameter and remove the must_param
variable that was previously set in order to pass the validation.

In kubernetes v23.3.0, 'available_replicas' must be set into status
of `StatefulSet`, so this patch also add a kuryr-kubernetes versioned
parameter temporarily to .zuul.yaml to make the response returned
by kubernetes correct.

Closes-Bug: #1968103
Change-Id: I9495ce0f0893e5f9a1d6c52b98c3db3928bd95a3

commit_message:
Ensure [DEFAULT] show_multiple_locations is cleared

The parameter was already deprecated, but it is still required in
some setup (eg. to leverage in-storage copy in a deployment with Ceph
used for cinder/glance).

Considering the parameter is still valid, this change ensures it is
removed by default, so that old value is properly removed from config
file.

Change-Id: I2477d5e271b017ee12546c67f4c3f3f9be89c062
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-glance refs/changes/64/839164/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
logging: Check for BadStatusLine before OSError

Otherwise you find yourself logging a traceback for a RemoteDisconnected
error (which inherits from *both*), when it really doesn't warrant one.

Change-Id: I951242ca76a9d1fd8bf4a2d885d0e260dd425788
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/swift refs/changes/68/839268/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: if isinstance(exc, (OSError, socket.error)): elif isinstance(exc, (http_client.BadStatusLine, green_http_client.BadStatusLine)): # Use error(); not really exceptional emsg = '%s: %s' % (exc.__class__.__name__, exc.line)

commit_message:
Fix transport_url with multiple rabbit servers

When RabbitMQ is deployed in HA mode the transport_url parameter of
masakari must reference all RabbitMQ instances. Previously it
referenced only one. Now uses the configuration from the base OpenStack
layer

Closes-Bug: #1950331
Change-Id: Iea9d4f2484b82c22939a258e7f9faa3030a9bd1e
(cherry picked from commit 4fe9f39585a7d034a2dc724165e5c4239e0aabd2)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charm-masakari refs/changes/61/837061/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Extend scale back hacluster operation - retry

Extend the scale back hacluster cloud operation from
using Vault as an example to replacing a Vault cluster
node. This consists essentially of adding a section on
scaling out the application.

Improve the Unseal Vault operation by linking to the
Vault TLS cloud operation.

Change-Id: Id2e146e7e5dbad8f1df4acb85f60728257ba526d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charm-guide refs/changes/71/839271/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: This article shows how to replace a Vault node in a cluster made highlyand then the addition of a vault unit. This is done with generic Juju commands and actions available to the hacluster charm. .. important:: This procedure will not result in cloud downtime providing that there is at least one functional Vault node present at all times. .. warning:: This procedure will involve a sealed Vault instance. Please ensure that the requisite number of unseal keys are available before continuing.This article will be based on the following (partial) output: vault/0* active idle 1/lxd/4 10.246.114.76 8200/tcp Unit is ready (active: false, mlock: disabled) vault-hacluster/1 active idle 10.246.114.76 Unit is ready and clustered vault-mysql-router/0* active idle 10.246.114.76 Unit is ready vault/3 active idle 0/lxd/8 10.246.114.83 8200/tcp Unit is ready (active: true, mlock: disabled) vault-hacluster/2 active idle 10.246.114.83 Unit is ready and clustered vault-mysql-router/25 active idle 10.246.114.83 Unit is ready vault/4 active idle 2/lxd/9 10.246.114.84 8200/tcp Unit is ready (active: false, mlock: disabled) vault-hacluster/0* active idle 10.246.114.84 Unit is ready and clustered vault-mysql-router/24 active idle 10.246.114.84 Unit is ready In this example, unit ``vault/3`` will be removed.Pause the hacluster unit that corresponds to the principal application unit being removed. Here, unit ``vault-hacluster/2`` corresponds to unit ``vault/3``: juju run-action --wait vault-hacluster/2 pause juju remove-unit vault/3Add a principal application unit ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ Add a principal application unit. We accomplish this by scaling out the existing vault application and placing the new (containerised) unit on the same host that the removed unit was on (machine 0): juju add-unit --to lxd:0 vault .. caution:: If network spaces are in use the above command will not succeed. See Juju issue `LP #1969523`_ for a workaround. The new :command:`juju status` output now contains: vault/0* active idle 1/lxd/4 10.246.114.76 8200/tcp Unit is ready (active: false, mlock: disabled) vault-hacluster/1 active idle 10.246.114.76 Unit is ready and clustered vault-mysql-router/0* active idle 10.246.114.76 Unit is ready vault/4 active idle 2/lxd/9 10.246.114.84 8200/tcp Unit is ready (active: true, mlock: disabled) vault-hacluster/0* active idle 10.246.114.84 Unit is ready and clustered vault-mysql-router/24 active idle 10.246.114.84 Unit is ready vault/6 blocked idle 0/lxd/9 10.246.114.83 8200/tcp Unit is sealed vault-hacluster/28 active idle 10.246.114.83 Unit is ready and clustered vault-mysql-router/40 active idle 10.246.114.83 Unit is ready Notice that the new vault unit (``vault/6``) is sealed. Unseal the new Vault instance ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ Here we will assume that the original Vault deploy was initialised with a requirement of three unseal keys. Set an environment variable based on the address of the newly-introduced unit, and unseal the instance: .. code-block:: none export VAULT_ADDR="http://10.246.114.83:8200" vault operator unseal vault operator unseal vault operator unseal For more information on unsealing Vault see cloud operation :doc:`Unseal Vault <ops-unseal-vault>`. Verify cloud services ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ The final :command:`juju status vault` (partial) output is: .. code-block:: console Unit Workload Agent Machine Public address Ports Message vault/0* active idle 1/lxd/4 10.246.114.76 8200/tcp Unit is ready (active: false, mlock: disabled) vault-hacluster/1 active idle 10.246.114.76 Unit is ready and clustered vault-mysql-router/0* active idle 10.246.114.76 Unit is ready vault/4 active idle 2/lxd/9 10.246.114.84 8200/tcp Unit is ready (active: true, mlock: disabled) vault-hacluster/0* active idle 10.246.114.84 Unit is ready and clustered vault-mysql-router/24 active idle 10.246.114.84 Unit is ready vault/6 active idle 0/lxd/9 10.246.114.83 8200/tcp Unit is ready (active: false, mlock: disabled) vault-hacluster/28 active idle 10.246.114.83 Unit is ready and clustered vault-mysql-router/40 active idle 10.246.114.83 Unit is ready .. LINKS .. _LP #1969523: https://bugs.launchpad.net/juju/+bug/1969523
deleted_lines: This article shows how to scale back an application that is made highlyof one or more of the principal application's units. This is easily done with generic Juju commands and actions available to the hacluster charm. .. note:: Since the application being scaled back is already in HA mode the removal of one of its cluster members should not cause any immediate interruption of cloud services. Scaling back an application will also remove its associated hacluster unit. It is best practice to have at least three hacluster units per application at all times. An odd number is also recommended.This article will be based on the following output: vault/0* active idle 0/lxd/5 10.0.0.227 8200/tcp Unit is ready (active: true, mlock: disabled) vault-hacluster/0* active idle 10.0.0.227 Unit is ready and clustered vault-mysql-router/0* active idle 10.0.0.227 Unit is ready vault/1 active idle 1/lxd/5 10.0.0.234 8200/tcp Unit is ready (active: true, mlock: disabled) vault-hacluster/1 active idle 10.0.0.234 Unit is ready and clustered vault-mysql-router/1 active idle 10.0.0.234 Unit is ready vault/2 active idle 2/lxd/6 10.0.0.233 8200/tcp Unit is ready (active: true, mlock: disabled) vault-hacluster/2 active idle 10.0.0.233 Unit is ready and clustered vault-mysql-router/2 active idle 10.0.0.233 Unit is ready In the below example, unit ``vault/1`` will be removed.Pause the hacluster unit that corresponds to the principle application unit being removed. Here, unit ``vault-hacluster/1`` corresponds to unit ``vault/1``: juju run-action --wait vault-hacluster/1 pause .. caution:: Unit numbers for a subordinate unit and its corresponding principal unit are not necessarily the same (e.g. it is possible to have ``vault-hacluster/2`` correspond to ``vault/1``). juju remove-unit vault/1Update the ``cluster_count`` value ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ Inform the hacluster charm about the new number of hacluster units, two here: juju config vault-hacluster cluster_count=2 In this example a count of two (less than three) removes quorum functionality and enables a two-node cluster. This is a sub-optimal state and is shown as an example only. Update Corosync ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ Remove Corosync nodes from its ring and update ``corosync.conf`` to reflect the new number of nodes (``min_quorum`` is recalculated): .. code-block:: none juju run-action --wait vault-hacluster/leader update-ring i-really-mean-it=true Check the status of the Corosync cluster by querying a remaining hacluster unit: .. code-block:: none juju ssh vault-hacluster/leader sudo crm status There should not be any node listed as OFFLINE. .. note:: With Juju client < 2.9 a subordinate leader unit must be referenced via its machine ID (e.g. 0/lxd/5) when using the :command:`juju ssh` command. Verify cloud services ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ For this example, the final :command:`juju status vault` output is: vault/0* active idle 0/lxd/5 10.0.0.227 8200/tcp Unit is ready (active: true, mlock: disabled) vault-hacluster/0* active idle 10.0.0.227 Unit is ready and clustered vault-mysql-router/0* active idle 10.0.0.227 Unit is ready vault/2 active idle 2/lxd/6 10.0.0.233 8200/tcp Unit is ready (active: true, mlock: disabled) vault-hacluster/2 active idle 10.0.0.233 Unit is ready and clustered vault-mysql-router/2 active idle 10.0.0.233 Unit is ready

commit_message:
Remove tempest.api.volume.admin.test_multi_backend test

tempest.api.volume.admin.test_multi_backend should be removed.
It was not used anywhere and now, the only possibility to turn it on,
the ``tempest_volume_multi_backend_enabled`` variable has been removed.

Change-Id: I502994fccf552fe7084e1527a90ea821b1cfa562

commit_message:
Use systemd_mount native syntax for mounts

Currently we have bunch of limitations related to the format
of ``glance_nfs_client``. While systemd_mount role is flexible enough
to allow mount cephfs or s3fs, variable format has weird assumptions
that we want to change for better flexability.

Since keys of variable are changing, new name for it was picked to
reflect purpose of the variable better.

Change-Id: Ic0d91a3a873b4253255beac79becf01b4a304695

commit_message:
Do not deploy api-paste for CentOS distro deployment

RDO stopped shipping api-paste file for glance, so we can't provide it
anymore. To avoid maintaining it for this usecase we simply stop
provisioning as well for this path.

Change-Id: I01440a4df4f4a1f7bb96d2bd672812c35963cdb3

commit_message:
Extend scale back hacluster operation

Extend the scale back hacluster cloud operation from
using Vault as an example to replacing a Vault cluster
node. This consists essentially of adding a section on
scaling out the application.

Improve the Unseal Vault operation by linking to the
Vault TLS cloud operation.

Change-Id: I0450476beea65a3853273dddd4abdbdc7313af7c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charm-guide refs/changes/32/838932/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

added_lines: ============================ Replace a Vault cluster node ============================This article shows how to replace a Vault node in a cluster made highly available by means of the subordinate hacluster charm. It implies the addition of an application unit and the removal of one unit. This is done with generic Juju commands and actions available to the hacluster charm.
deleted_lines: ================================================== Scale back an application with the hacluster charm ==================================================This article shows how to scale back an application that is made highly available by means of the subordinate hacluster charm. It implies the removal of one or more of the principal application's units. This is easily done with generic Juju commands and actions available to the hacluster charm. Since the application being scaled back is already in HA mode the removal of one of its cluster members should not cause any immediate interruption of cloud services.

commit_message:
Disable GSSAPIAuthentication by default

Having GSSAPIAuthentication enabled by default
can cause issues during the deployment process
if the user is unable to authenticate with kerberos.

This change moves the default for GSSAPIAuthentication
to no instead of yes.

Conflicts:

commit_message:
[train-only] Add is_ipv6 condition and CloudDomain in network.j2

Change I98a3d582add0d6881cd39433ddb25515f0e0dc31 fixed
a "ManageNetworks" use-case, but relies on is_ipv6

in the patch.

commit_message:
Clarifies the zone import error message

This patch defines the situation where the import_zone exception handler
produces the message 'An undefined error occurred' to the exception during
the zone import where an underlying exception occurred from the rpc
dispatcher at the same time as a duplicate zone exception. Kiall Mac Innes
explains this in
https://opendev.org/openstack/designate/commit/2c9460505d07d0e46765a552b637e5a3296b667b
the problem here is in the way the _import_zone was written where
https://github.com/openstack/designate/commit/9b809a11b3068552274340606eb76d2217411b85
was written with threading.local, so it only works if it stays within the same
thread. Since _import_zone is created on a separate thread, the necessity to add
the decorator @rpc_expected_exceptions() at the top.

Closes-bug: #1950118
Closes-bug: #1964323
Change-Id: If7d50cbd4fa0ce86e0ddf03068da36acd7d72cb4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/designate refs/changes/51/835651/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: except messaging.rpc.dispatcher.ExpectedException as e: # This situation can occurred in conjuction with the zone # creation and presents itself as a confussing underlying # exception to another exception becuase of its wrapped # notification nature. LOG.exception( "An rpc dispatcher expected exception occurred during " "zone creation." ) zone_import.message = ( "An rpc dispatcher expected exception occurred during " "zone creation. %s" % str(e)[:130] ) zone_import.status = 'ERROR'

commit_message:
Add galera_data_dir variable

Control mysql datadir with variable. Decrease code dublication since path
is heavily used in different places. If path needs to be changed
overriding config won't be enough.

commit_message:
Use separate tmp directory

During upgrades or cluster repairments, temporary directories are created
inside /var/lib/mysql and treated as databases. This results in errors
during mysqlcheck like:

`Got error: 1102: Incorrect database name '#mysql50#tmp.stLr46FBlt'`

Path outside of datadir is not choosen since it could be separate mount
point and it's important for replication
to survive reboots.

Change-Id: Ia110dd9ed09b04f6bb7a0a3adf5a808966558507
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-galera_server refs/changes/50/831550/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: galera_tmp_dir: /var/lib/mysql/#tmp galera_ignore_db_dirs: - '#tmp'

subject: Disable auto discovery
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-03-28 10:40:45.000000000', 'files': ['setup.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/grenade/commit/3114725b5087809e6c4bb34bfe69dbfe051c09b2', 'message': "Disable auto discovery

Tripleo-ci jobs are broken after latest release of setuptools 61.0
because of breaking changes which are not backwork compatible,
details in related bug and [1].

Users that don't set ``packages``, ``py_modules``, or `configuration`
are still likely to observe the auto-discovery behavior, which may
halt the build if the project contains multiple directories and/or
multiple Python files directly under the project root.

To disable auto discovery, one can do below in setup.py

~~~
setuptools.setup(..,packages=[],..)
~~~

or

~~~
setuptools.setup(..,py_modules=[],..)
~~~

[1] https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/issues/3197

Releated-Bug: #1966382

Signed-off-by: Jiri Podivin <jpodivin@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I8ba2f6eccb9f279406321915793709e50e8279d4
"}]
commit_message:
Disable auto discovery

Tripleo-ci jobs are broken after latest release of setuptools 61.0
because of breaking changes which are not backwork compatible,
details in related bug and [1].

Users that don't set ``packages``, ``py_modules``, or `configuration`
are still likely to observe the auto-discovery behavior, which may
halt the build if the project contains multiple directories and/or
multiple Python files directly under the project root.

To disable auto discovery, one can do below in setup.py

~~~
setuptools.setup(..,packages=[],..)
~~~

or

~~~
setuptools.setup(..,py_modules=[],..)
~~~

[1] https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/issues/3197

Releated-Bug: #1966382

Signed-off-by: Jiri Podivin <jpodivin@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I8ba2f6eccb9f279406321915793709e50e8279d4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/grenade refs/changes/35/835435/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: py_modules=[],

commit_message:
install mod_ssl on centos 9 stream by default

This change adds mod_ssl to the default set of rpms installed
on rpm based distros.

this is required if the tls-proxy service is enabled
for multi node centos based jobs.

Change-Id: I52652de88352094c824da68e5baf7db4c17cb027

subject: Make ipxe-boot image EFI capable
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-04-25 15:05:58.000000000', 'files': ['ipxe/Makefile', 'doc/source/host-cloud/prepare.rst', 'ipxe/ipxe', 'ipxe/README'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-virtual-baremetal/commit/b99ed4692cb61f041125673e6de7b12ea4622ae3', 'message': 'Make ipxe-boot image EFI capable

This refreshes the ipxe build makefile to build an image
that works in both legacy BIOS and UEFI environments.

This makes the following changes:
- Moves the ipxe submodule commit to current master
- Creates an EFI partition efi.img containing ipxe.efi
  as the default binary
- Builds ipxe-boot.img as an MBR/GPT hybrid ISO which boots
  and runs iPXE in both legacy BIOS and UEFI environments
- Stop creating ipxe-boot.qcow2 since the conversion from
  ipxe-boot.img has an incorrect EFI partition, and there is
  no real benefit over the raw image anyway
- Refresh the documentation for how to upload the images to
  an OpenStack cloud, remove the redundancy from ipxe/README

Change-Id: I720ed5aaa0d55ded73e01aaba9db66602adc26cd
(cherry picked from commit ce863ae11c6338d9269df3020db7e82f7608a30e)
'}]
commit_message:
Make ipxe-boot image EFI capable

This refreshes the ipxe build makefile to build an image
that works in both legacy BIOS and UEFI environments.

This makes the following changes:
- Moves the ipxe submodule commit to current master
- Creates an EFI partition efi.img containing ipxe.efi
  as the default binary
- Builds ipxe-boot.img as an MBR/GPT hybrid ISO which boots
  and runs iPXE in both legacy BIOS and UEFI environments
- Stop creating ipxe-boot.qcow2 since the conversion from
  ipxe-boot.img has an incorrect EFI partition, and there is
  no real benefit over the raw image anyway
- Refresh the documentation for how to upload the images to
  an OpenStack cloud, remove the redundancy from ipxe/README

Change-Id: I720ed5aaa0d55ded73e01aaba9db66602adc26cd
(cherry picked from commit ce863ae11c6338d9269df3020db7e82f7608a30e)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-virtual-baremetal refs/changes/86/839186/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: This directory contains tools for for building an IPXE image. Run ``make`` to build the image. It is provided as both raw and qcow2. The iPXE image has minimal build dependencies. On a Fedora system, these are: * gcc * genisoimage * make * qemu-img * syslinux-nonlinux * xz-devel Please ping Ben Nemec <openstack@nemebean.com> when making a change which affects the ipxe image to update the public repo of pre-built images.
